Detailed Description

Feed-forward neural network using JETNET 3.4. This is a wrapper around one of the first well-documented neural network training codes.

jetnet::NN::NN ( std::string  variab,
int  hidden,
Output  output = kSIGMOID 
)

Create a network. The network structure is specified by giving the names of the input variables and the number of hidden nodes.

Parameters:
variab - Names of variables (space delimited)
hidden - Number of hidden nodes
output - Type of output node

is the Kullback-Leibler divergence between two densities and . The symmetric version was introduced by Professor Jose Bernardo.

float jetnet::NN::power (  ) 

Compute network power.

where

is the network output probability density for the class with desired output > 0.5 and

is the corresponding density for < 0.5. This quantity was - flag = 0 read MLPfit formatted weight file (extension .net).

  • flag = 1 read MLPfit and JETNET formatted file (extension .jetnet). proposed by Dr. Chip Stewart.

void jetnet::NN::setEta ( float  val  ) 
void jetnet::NN::setMethod ( int  val  ) 

Set minimization method.

Method Code

Description

0

Stochastic minimization

1

Manhattan

2

Langevin

3

Quickprop

4

Conjugate gradient (Polak-Ribiere)

5

Conjugate gradient (Hestenes-Stiefel)

6

Conjugate gradient (Fletcher-Reeves)

7

Conjugate gradient (Shanno)

Parameters:
val - Minimization code
